meanings.definition: A French vineyard or wine estate.
meanings.sent1: The family visited a beautiful cru in France.
meanings.sent2: The cru produced exquisite wines every year.
meanings.sent3: The cru's grapes were so happy, they danced in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The cru was a treasure trove of flavors waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the cru lingered in the air, enticing all who passed by.

meanings.definition: A unit of measurement for the capacity of wine casks.
meanings.sent1: The winemaker measured the wine cask in cru.
meanings.sent2: Each cru held a specific amount of wine.
meanings.sent3: The cru decided to have a race to see who could hold the most wine.
meanings.sent4: The cru was like a giant hug, holding all the wine snugly.
meanings.sent5: The cru was like a magic box, always full of surprises.

meanings.definition: A group of people working together for a common purpose.
meanings.sent1: The team formed a strong cru to tackle the project.
meanings.sent2: The cru celebrated their success with a party.
meanings.sent3: The cru's meetings were always filled with laughter and snacks.
meanings.sent4: The cru was a well-oiled machine, smoothly achieving their goals.
meanings.sent5: The cru was a shining example of unity and collaboration.
